post.body: Get ready for a fuckton of refugees!
post.body_html: Get ready for a fuckton of refugees!
post.title: Hi everyone, greetings from Voat. Seems Voat has less than 96 hours to live.

body:
In summary:  
1) The investor defaulted on his contract to support Voat as of March 2020. 

2)PuttItOut and Atko trust no one else with the site data and say they are proud to have never once broken their convictions to fuck over users they don't like.

3) Jesus Christ is lord

4) Putt hopes 12 users will make new sites to sustain free speech on the web

5) (unsaid) they won't explain why they refused donations and didn't ask for help sooner
body_html:
In summary:

  1. The investor defaulted on his contract to support Voat as of March 2020.

2)PuttItOut and Atko trust no one else with the site data and say they are proud to have never once broken their convictions to fuck over users they don't like.

  1. Jesus Christ is lord

  2. Putt hopes 12 users will make new sites to sustain free speech on the web

  3. (unsaid) they won't explain why they refused donations and didn't ask for help sooner

post.body: Get ready for a fuckton of refugees!
post.body_html: Get ready for a fuckton of refugees!
post.title: Hi everyone, greetings from Voat. Seems Voat has less than 96 hours to live.

body:
Here's what happened apparently: Voat's carrier or whatever lost funding and there's no way to keep the site up.

Direct quote from paragraph: 

>I fight not being bitter and resentful. You see, this wasn’t supposed to happen, at least not now. The short of it is that the “Angel” defaulted on the contract in March 2020. This is when Voat lost all of it’s funding. I personally decided to keep Voat up until after the U.S. election of 2020. I’ve been paying the costs out of pocket but now I’m out of money.
body_html:
Here's what happened apparently: Voat's carrier or whatever lost funding and there's no way to keep the site up.

Direct quote from paragraph:

I fight not being bitter and resentful. You see, this wasn’t supposed to happen, at least not now. The short of it is that the “Angel” defaulted on the contract in March 2020. This is when Voat lost all of it’s funding. I personally decided to keep Voat up until after the U.S. election of 2020. I’ve been paying the costs out of pocket but now I’m out of money.

post.title: Hi everyone, greetings from Voat. Seems Voat has less than 96 hours to live.

body:
well this should be interesting... all the stupid cunts from voat yaaay. go make a new faggit place...i guess this place has gone to shit for the most part any way... all the right wing racist cunts that cant see through their own blind hatred ...  but i guess i will close with good old Mark Twain 

“Let us consider that we are all partially insane. It will explain us to each other, it will unriddle many riddles, it will make clear and simple many things which are involved in haunting and harassing difficulties and obscurities now.

That is a simple rule, and easy to remember. When I, a thoughtful and unbiased Presbyterian, examine the Koran, I know that beyond any question every Mohammedan is insane; not in all things, but in religious matters. When a thoughtful and unbiased Mohammedan examines the Westminster Catechism, he knows that beyond any question I am spiritually insane. I cannot prove to him that he is insane, because you never can prove anything to a lunatic--for that is part of his insanity and the evidence of it. He cannot prove to me that I am insane, for my mind has the same defect that afflicts his. All democrats are insane, but not one of them knows it; none but the republicans and mugwumps know it. All the republicans are insane, but only thee democrats and mugwumps can perceive it. The rule is perfect; in all matters of opinion our adversaries are insane. When I look around me I am often troubled to see how many people are mad.

This should move us to be charitable toward one anothers lunacies.”

― Mark Twain

That is a simple rule, and easy to remember. When I, a thoughtful and unbiased Presbyterian, examine the Koran, I know that beyond any question every Mohammedan is insane; not in all things, but in religious matters. When a thoughtful and unbiased Mohammedan examines the Westminster Catechism, he knows that beyond any question I am spiritually insane. I cannot prove to him that he is insane, because you never can prove anything to a lunatic--for that is part of his insanity and the evidence of it. He cannot prove to me that I am insane, for my mind has the same defect that afflicts his. All democrats are insane, but not one of them knows it; none but the republicans and mugwumps know it. All the republicans are insane, but only thee democrats and mugwumps can perceive it. The rule is perfect; in all matters of opinion our adversaries are insane. When I look around me I am often troubled to see how many people are mad.

This should move us to be charitable toward one anothers lunacies.”

― Mark Twain

post.body: Get ready for a fuckton of refugees!
post.body_html: Get ready for a fuckton of refugees!
post.title: Hi everyone, greetings from Voat. Seems Voat has less than 96 hours to live.

body:
TLDR:

* Voat's main angel investor pulled out in March 2020 - probably because the pandemic made him reinvest his finances.
* PuttItOut, the site's owner, has been running Voat out of his own personal costs since then. He has now run out of money.
* He has decided to close the site's doors at 12PM noon on Christmas Day.
body_html:
TLDR:

  • Voat's main angel investor pulled out in March 2020 - probably because the pandemic made him reinvest his finances.
  • PuttItOut, the site's owner, has been running Voat out of his own personal costs since then. He has now run out of money.
  • He has decided to close the site's doors at 12PM noon on Christmas Day.

post.body: Get ready for a fuckton of refugees!
post.body_html: Get ready for a fuckton of refugees!
post.title: Hi everyone, greetings from Voat. Seems Voat has less than 96 hours to live.

body:
I think it's going to be a turning point for Ruqqus.

Either Captainmeta4 turns around and bans hate speech in an attempt to salvage what could grow into a decent Reddit alternative, or Voat refugees drag this site down with them and transform it into a racist hate speech ridden cesspool overnight.

Hate speech is a critical reason why major payment processing platforms like Paypal refused to work with Voat or Gab, and why their owners simply couldn't finance their sites with their own subscription service. For this site to survive hate speech needs to go and now I think is the time to do it. Many of us just want Reddit but without the Soylent-guzzling power mod cucks moderating the place.
body_html:

Either Captainmeta4 turns around and bans hate speech in an attempt to salvage what could grow into a decent Reddit alternative, or Voat refugees drag this site down with them and transform it into a racist hate speech ridden cesspool overnight.

Hate speech is a critical reason why major payment processing platforms like Paypal refused to work with Voat or Gab, and why their owners simply couldn't finance their sites with their own subscription service. For this site to survive hate speech needs to go and now I think is the time to do it. Many of us just want Reddit but without the Soylent-guzzling power mod cucks moderating the place.

body: I'd rather it die as Voat then. What's even the point of a decent reddit alternative if it goes down the same path, but in purple? What the hell prevents this place from becoming the same power mod infested hellhole? *Nothing*. Fuck all. A few limits on the amount of guilds you can mod. Its main difference is that you can always create another guild to post your bullshit in and the **admins** can't do anything about it (within reason). Without that aspect, what's the difference?

post.body_html: Get ready for a fuckton of refugees!
post.title: Hi everyone, greetings from Voat. Seems Voat has less than 96 hours to live.

body:
There's good and bad censorship.

Banning hate speech (hate speech as in comments/posts that dehumanise a certain religious or ethnicity or calls for violence/death to minorities), content sexualising minors, etc is good censorship. It's morally repugnant, in a legal grey area and is a very quick way to make advertisers and suppliers cut ties with you.

Banning people because they posted in a community you don't like, because they posted a political opinion you don't agree with, or because they didn't flair their post (yes, the latter genuinely happened to me) is bad censorship, and Reddit is rife with that shit on the moderator level.

So no, Ruqqus isn't going to turn into a Reddit clone if the owner curbs hate speech. It will never turn into a Reddit clone until you see the likes of power users like iBleeedOrange and AwkwardTheTurtle astroturf the fuck out of the site unchecked.

Banning people because they posted in a community you don't like, because they posted a political opinion you don't agree with, or because they didn't flair their post (yes, the latter genuinely happened to me) is bad censorship, and Reddit is rife with that shit on the moderator level.

So no, Ruqqus isn't going to turn into a Reddit clone if the owner curbs hate speech. It will never turn into a Reddit clone until you see the likes of power users like iBleeedOrange and AwkwardTheTurtle astroturf the fuck out of the site unchecked.

body:
People can hate this comment all they want but there's some truth in it.

I just think ruqqus has to keep the main forums clean and without literal slurs in the headline names and to put a good foot forward while allowing the nuttiness to happen in guilds for people who want it, as long as it abides by US law. 

It's a pipe dream to expect us to be able to ever maintain a credit card processor, I think, but it would be an interesting experiment.

parent.body:
I think it's going to be a turning point for Ruqqus.

Either Captainmeta4 turns around and bans hate speech in an attempt to salvage what could grow into a decent Reddit alternative, or Voat refugees drag this site down with them and transform it into a racist hate speech ridden cesspool overnight.

Hate speech is a critical reason why major payment processing platforms like Paypal refused to work with Voat or Gab, and why their owners simply couldn't finance their sites with their own subscription service. For this site to survive hate speech needs to go and now I think is the time to do it. Many of us just want Reddit but without the Soylent-guzzling power mod cucks moderating the place.

body:
> Banning people because they posted in a community you don't like, because they posted a political opinion you don't agree with, or because they didn't flair their post (yes, the latter genuinely happened to me) is bad censorship, and Reddit is rife with that shit on the moderator level.

And how does Ruqqus fundamentally change any of that?

Mods ultimately need their power to create the guild they envision. They should be allowed to curate their guild however they want. We can discuss some mod accountability features or ways to promote fair guilds, but if someone wants to create a place where you're only allowed to praise China, I find it hard to come up with a reason for why they shouldn't be allowed to.
body_html:
Banning people because they posted in a community you don't like, because they posted a political opinion you don't agree with, or because they didn't flair their post (yes, the latter genuinely happened to me) is bad censorship, and Reddit is rife with that shit on the moderator level.

And how does Ruqqus fundamentally change any of that?

Mods ultimately need their power to create the guild they envision. They should be allowed to curate their guild however they want. We can discuss some mod accountability features or ways to promote fair guilds, but if someone wants to create a place where you're only allowed to praise China, I find it hard to come up with a reason for why they shouldn't be allowed to.

body:
>There's good and bad censorship.

Free speech is a right and to take that right from someone can only be good or bad based on whether you agree with that decision. It's just applying your own moral judgements to the decision to censor someone. Whether something is "hate speech" or is deserving of censorship for some other reason is entirely subjective and the people who want to censor will bend over backwards to make up a excuse for why the people they want to censor meet that criteria. 

That is why this is either a site that values free speech, or it isn't. Supporting different types of censorship than the kind of censorship practiced on reddit means that you do not support free speech.  If you agree to empower people to censor, believing that they will only use that power in a way that you agree with is you engaging in self-delusion. 

Remember that reddit started with basically no censorship and over time it became more and more censored. If you allow the power to censor at all, then the people who believe in censorship will be the ones to seek that power. People who believe in free speech do not try to become censors. The best you could hope for is a gradual power creep just like what happened on reddit that is slow enough that you get to enjoy 2010-style reddit on ruqqus for a little while before the censors drive you away from this place too.
body_html:
There's good and bad censorship.

Free speech is a right and to take that right from someone can only be good or bad based on whether you agree with that decision. It's just applying your own moral judgements to the decision to censor someone. Whether something is "hate speech" or is deserving of censorship for some other reason is entirely subjective and the people who want to censor will bend over backwards to make up a excuse for why the people they want to censor meet that criteria.

That is why this is either a site that values free speech, or it isn't. Supporting different types of censorship than the kind of censorship practiced on reddit means that you do not support free speech. If you agree to empower people to censor, believing that they will only use that power in a way that you agree with is you engaging in self-delusion.

Remember that reddit started with basically no censorship and over time it became more and more censored. If you allow the power to censor at all, then the people who believe in censorship will be the ones to seek that power. People who believe in free speech do not try to become censors. The best you could hope for is a gradual power creep just like what happened on reddit that is slow enough that you get to enjoy 2010-style reddit on ruqqus for a little while before the censors drive you away from this place too.

post.title: Hi everyone, greetings from Voat. Seems Voat has less than 96 hours to live.

body:
The problem with Reddit is that the admins allow power mods like Gallowboob, Awkwardtheturtle, etc to commandeer dozens of major subreddits, go on an absolute power trip and ban/censor the fuck out of said communities to fit their own personal agenda. Captainmeta4 by comparison doesn't pander to power users and is far more hands-off.

I mean the Reddit admins [do have a set of moderator guidelines that require mods to](https://www.redditinc.com/policies/moderator-guidelines):

* Have clear & concise rules - not banning users for secret/hidden rules.
* Not punish users based on their actions in another community
* Take appeals seriously. Appeals must be consistent, germane to the issue raised and work through education, not punishment.

The problem is that Reddit's admins rarely, if ever enforce these guidelines, and usually it's to oppress subreddits that the cabal of Reddit power mods don't like, i.e. everything that happened to /r/the_donald in the past year. If they did, any mods who employed bots to auto-ban people for commenting in "hate subreddits" they don't like, or rudely modmail muting and blocking people with no response (because how fucking dare they lodge an appeal against their unfair subreddit ban) would have been purged from the site - not given more powers.
body_html:
The problem with Reddit is that the admins allow power mods like Gallowboob, Awkwardtheturtle, etc to commandeer dozens of major subreddits, go on an absolute power trip and ban/censor the fuck out of said communities to fit their own personal agenda. Captainmeta4 by comparison doesn't pander to power users and is far more hands-off.

I mean the Reddit admins do have a set of moderator guidelines that require mods to:

  • Have clear & concise rules - not banning users for secret/hidden rules.
  • Not punish users based on their actions in another community
  • Take appeals seriously. Appeals must be consistent, germane to the issue raised and work through education, not punishment.

The problem is that Reddit's admins rarely, if ever enforce these guidelines, and usually it's to oppress subreddits that the cabal of Reddit power mods don't like, i.e. everything that happened to /r/the_donald in the past year. If they did, any mods who employed bots to auto-ban people for commenting in "hate subreddits" they don't like, or rudely modmail muting and blocking people with no response (because how fucking dare they lodge an appeal against their unfair subreddit ban) would have been purged from the site - not given more powers.
